dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: Analyst on Apple (AAPL): ‘I Don’t Think AI is a Story Yet’
News Content: We recently published a list of Top 10 AI News You Shouldn’t Miss. In this article, we are going to take a look at where Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) stands against other top AI news you shouldn’t miss.

All everyone could talk about in the technical AI landscape these days is DeepSeek-R1, a Chinese open-source LLM that analysts believe can give major American AI companies a run for their money. Why is DeepSeek making waves and why is it called a breakthrough in the AI race?

DeepSeek AI model is several times cheaper to use for professional purposes when compared to its American counterparts including OpenAI’s o1 model. Media reports also suggest the model beat almost all key AI models in the industry by significant margins.

CNBC’s Deirdre Bosa explained what makes these Chinese models a challenge for US tech companies:

“The cost, I mean, these models coming out of China are just built at a fraction of the price when you think about OpenAI. That’s spending $5 billion a year, burning through billions of dollars a year. These models, the DeepSeek for example, they say they built it for less than $6 million. ByteDance as well, you know, shows that it was built and you can access it at much, much lower prices. So, this really turns on sort of this truth that we have thought about generative AI for the last few years—that you need hundreds of millions of dollars to develop bigger and better models. What the Chinese labs and companies are doing is they’re going straight to the frontier. They’re building with sort of infrastructure and outputs that are already out there, built in many cases by American companies and startups, and they’re improving on it, they’re innovating on it, and producing models that are just as good, in some cases, at a fraction of the cost.”

READ ALSO: 7 Best Stocks to Buy For Long-Term and 8 Cheap Jim Cramer Stocks to Invest In

For this article, we picked 10 AI stocks currently in the news. With each company we have mentioned the number of hedge fund investors. Why are we interested in the stocks that hedge funds pile into? The reason is simple: our research has shown that we can outperform the market by imitating the top stock picks of the best hedge funds. Our quarterly newsletter’s strategy selects 14 small-cap and large-cap stocks every quarter and has returned 275% since May 2014, beating its benchmark by 150 percentage points (see more details here).Analyst on Apple (AAPL): ‘I Don’t Think AI is a Story Yet’

guteksk7/Shutterstock.com

Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL)

Number of Hedge Fund Investors: 158

Bonawyn Eison, Chief Investment Officer and Managing Partner, Wynsource Partners, recently said on CNBC that he does not believe AI would be a strong enough driver for Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) to take the company to the next level.

Story Continues

“I just don’t understand what the real drivers of the super cycle are, and if AI is the catalyst behind it, I can understand that. They don’t have the same cashback spend as some of the other MAGs, so there’s a floor there. But in terms of what’s going to take what is already a fully valued company to the next level and lead to, either for me, P/E expansion, I don’t think AI is a story yet, or I don’t see it.”

Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) is desperately in need of new catalysts. The company’s revenue in China fell 8% in fiscal year 2024, following a 2% decline the previous year. The Chinese market accounts for about 15% of Apple’s total revenue, so this downtrend cannot be ignored.

Investors had hopes from the Wearables, Home, and Accessories segment, but so far its performance has been weak. Vision Pro faces tough competition from Meta’s $500 Quest and the more affordable Quest 3S, making it hard to justify its $3,500 price tag. The failure of Apple’s HomePod, unable to compete with Amazon’s and Google’s lower-priced offerings, further highlights the challenges in this market.

Apple’s iPhone 16 has not shown promising growth prospects yet and investors are still in a wait-and-see mode on the AI platform.

CDT Capital Management stated the following regarding Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) in its Q4 2024 investor letter:

“The crowd. While this evolution in AI is going to change the world, market expectations for the technology have become unhinged. The crowd, which is more like an exuberant mob, anointed the Mag 7 with spectacular, nonsensical valuations based on the premise that AI will be an amazing, money-printing growth engine for these companies – and the truth is it likely will be. The problem is that the math just isn’t mathing.

Overall, AAPL ranks 3rd on our list of top AI news you shouldn’t miss. While we acknowledge the potential of AAPL, our conviction lies in the belief that under the radar AI stocks hold greater promise for delivering higher returns, and doing so within a shorter time frame. If you are looking for an AI stock that is more promising than AAPL but that trades at less than 5 times its earnings, check out our report about the cheapest AI stock.

READ NEXT: 20 Best AI Stocks To Buy Now and Complete List of 59 AI Companies Under $2 Billion in Market Cap

Disclosure: None. This article is originally published at Insider Monkey.

View Comments

Next I will provide you some predictions of stock price movement probabilities and the corresponding analysis by others in the previous rounds.
Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.
Previous predictions:
Round: 0
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.65, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.35, Reasoning: Apple's stock price saw a significant jump of over 3.7%, fueled by rising iPhone build estimates from JPMorgan and investor optimism about more efficient on-device AI. The company's strong position in response to the overall market's AI sell-off indicates resilience. However, it is also important to consider that the stock is still 12% off recent highs and facing potential downgrades and concerns over iPhone sales. Given these mixed signals, the probability of stock price increase is higher due to immediate positive feedback from the recent news, while downside risks still exist.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news article is a summary of a Zacks Market Edge podcast episode discussing five stocks, including Apple (AAPL). While Apple is mentioned alongside other companies, the article highlights a year-to-date decline of 11.3% and a Zacks Rank of 4 (Sell). Although it notes that Apple's P/E of 30.1 might still be considered high considering the recent stock dip, the unfavorable Zacks rank and negative recent performance suggest a slightly higher probability of a further price decrease in the short term. However, the concluding comment that Apple potentially provides a buying opportunity should it decline further mitigates the negative sentiment. The overall sentiment is mixed, leaning slightly negative due to the zacks rating and recent poor performance. Therefore, an immediate strong downward movement is not anticipated, but a slight downward trend is more probable based on the provided information.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.35, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.65, Reasoning: Apple's upcoming earnings report is anticipated to show modest growth (8.3% earnings, 3.7% revenue), which is weaker than previous quarters.  While Apple's track record shows positive earnings surprises (average 5.05%), the negative Earnings ESP (-1.51%) and Zacks Rank #4 (Sell) suggest a higher likelihood of disappointing the market.  Furthermore, the recent underperformance (-4.6% over three months), the weak sales guidance ('low to mid-single digit' growth), and Jefferies' downgrade to underperform all point to a bearish outlook. While the introduction of AI features is positive, the limited current impact suggests this won't fully offset the other negative factors in the short term. The news article focuses on the broader 'Magnificent Seven' and doesn't provide any specific bullish news for Apple.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The news highlights several factors that could impact Apple Inc.'s stock price: 1) The tech sector is tumbling due to concerns over DeepSeek AI's new model, which could negatively affect investor sentiment towards tech stocks, including Apple. 2) Apple is set to report earnings this week, and earnings reports often lead to volatility. Given the current negative sentiment in the tech sector, there may be heightened risk of a negative reaction. 3) The Federal Reserve's upcoming policy meeting could influence broader market trends, but its direct impact on Apple is less clear. Considering the immediate negative sentiment in the tech sector and the uncertainty around earnings, the probability of a stock price fall is higher than a rise in the short term.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The news article discusses Apple's current position in the AI landscape and highlights concerns from an analyst about AI being a strong driver for Apple's stock price. The analyst, Bonawyn Eison, expresses skepticism about AI being a catalyst for Apple to reach the next level, citing the company's fully valued status and the need for new catalysts. Additionally, Apple's recent financial performance, such as an 8% decline in revenue in China, and weak performance in the Wearables, Home, and Accessories segment, contribute to the negative outlook. The article also mentions competition in the AI space from cheaper Chinese models like DeepSeek-R1, which could potentially challenge American AI companies. Based on this analysis, the news seems to have a negative impact on Apple's stock price prospects.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.7, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.3, Reasoning: The news article indicates that Apple's stock price has surged due to the unveiling of a cost-effective AI model by Chinese AI upstart DeepSeek, which could lead to better on-device AI for iPhones. Additionally, JPMorgan has raised its iPhone build estimates for 1H25, citing better-than-expected demand out of China. However, the stock is still 12% off its recent highs due to iPhone sales concerns and downgrades from some analysts. Considering these factors, the probability of the stock price rising is higher than falling, but there is still some uncertainty.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.25, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.75, Reasoning: The financial news highlights skepticism around AI as a key driver for Apple's future growth. The analyst argues that current trends and developments in AI, such as DeepSeek-R1, pose competitive challenges. Additionally, Apple faces issues in critical markets like China and in product segments such as Wearables and Vision Pro, suggesting current growth drivers are weak. These factors cumulatively imply a bearish sentiment which may pressure the stock price.
Round: 1
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news highlights a significant rise in Apple's stock, driven by positive sentiment following JPMorgan's raised iPhone build estimates and the introduction of an efficient AI model by DeepSeek, which could enhance Apple's on-device AI capabilities. Despite being 12% off recent highs and facing some analyst downgrades, the immediate market reaction to the AI news and increased iPhone orders suggests a strong bullish sentiment for Apple. However, underlying concerns regarding iPhone sales and broader tech sector volatility due to AI competition indicate risks that could lead to a downward movement. Balancing these factors, the probability of the stock price rising appears higher than that of falling, but caution is warranted due to the noted risks.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.35, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.65, Reasoning: The news article provides a mixed outlook for Apple. While Apple is a 'Magnificent 7' stock and part of Berkshire Hathaway's holdings, it has declined 11.3% year-to-date. The stock trades at a high forward P/E of 30.1, and it has a Zacks Rank of 4 (Sell). This suggests that analysts don't have a very positive near-term outlook. However, the article also raises the question of whether further declines would represent a buying opportunity. The overall sentiment is cautiously negative in the short term, implying a slightly higher probability of a price decrease. Considering that in previous rounds, most models also indicated a higher chance of price falling, with some recent models fluctuating. I will stick to the overall sentiment and consider the trend of the previous predictions to adjust the probabilities accordingly.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.38, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.62, Reasoning: The news piece provides a mixed outlook for Apple. While it's included in the 'Magnificent Seven,'  a group of high-growth tech stocks, the specific details regarding Apple are less positive.  The Zacks Rank of #4 (Sell), negative Earnings ESP (-1.51%), modest projected earnings and revenue growth (8.3% and 3.7% respectively), weak sales guidance, and a recent downgrade by Jefferies all point towards a higher probability of a price fall in the short term. While Apple's strong track record of earnings surprises and the potential for future AI integration are positive factors, they are currently overshadowed by the immediate negative indicators.  The consensus among previous predictions leans bearish, further reinforcing this assessment.  However, the probability isn't overwhelmingly negative because Apple remains a significant player in a growth sector and positive surprises are possible. Therefore, I assign a slightly higher probability to a price fall, but acknowledge the potential for upside.

(AAPL). The tech sector is experiencing a downturn due to concerns over DeepSeek AI's new model, which could negatively impact Apple. Taking these factors into account, the probability of a stock price increase is moderate, while the probability of a decline remains relatively high due to the overall market sentiment and uncertainty heading into the upcoming earnings report.

However, the stock remains 12% off its recent highs, and there are ongoing concerns about iPhone sales and negative analyst downgrades. Broader market pressures from the AI sector also weigh heavily on investor sentiment. While there are both bullish and bearish signals, overall market sentiment leans slightly negative, suggesting that the probability of a stock price fall is marginally higher than that of a rise.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.42, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.58, Reasoning: The news article highlights both positive and negative aspects of Apple (AAPL). On the negative side, the stock has declined 11.3% year-to-date and carries a Zacks Rank of 4 (Sell), indicating analysts' unfavorable near-term outlook. Additionally, the high P/E ratio might suggest overvaluation. The Zacks Market Edge podcast mentions Apple, but offers no immediate specific positive signals beyond a question on buying opportunities if the stock falls further. On the positive side, Apple is part of the 'Magnificent 7', part of Berkshire Hathaway's holdings, and a potential AI advancement. 

Reviewing past predictions, there's a clear shift in sentiment back toward a more bearish outlook. Initial reactions to supposed good news were dampened, with models increasingly focusing on fundamental weaknesses and negative analyst ratings. The average probabilities across the last round leaned towards a higher likelihood of a price fall.

Given these factors and the slightly bearish trend, a higher probability is assigned to the stock price falling. However, the potential value of Apple, its position in the 'Magnificent 7' and the brand recognition temper the probability; meaning there's also a significant chance the price might rise.

Now give your prediction about the probability of the stock price of the relevant company rising or falling. Format your response in JSON format and include the following information as follows: 
{ 
"reasoning": "[Summarize your analysis and reasoning process here]", 
"company_name": "[Company Name indicating the name of the company]", 
"company_symbol": "[Company Symbol indicating the stock symbol of the company]", 
"news_headline": "[News Headline indicating the provided financial news headline]", 
"probability_of_stock_price_rise": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will rise due to this news], 
"probability_of_stock_price_fall": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will fall due to this news], 
} 
Do not generate output that isn't in properly formatted JSON.

```json
{
  "reasoning": "The financial news and previous predictions indicate a mixed but slightly negative outlook for Apple Inc. (AAPL). The analyst's skepticism about AI being a strong driver for Apple's stock price, combined with the company's recent financial performance issues, such as an 8% decline in revenue in China and weak performance in the Wearables, Home, and Accessories segment, contribute to the negative outlook. Additionally, competition in the AI space from cheaper Chinese models like DeepSeek-R1 poses a challenge. However, there are positive signals like JPMorgan raising iPhone build estimates and the introduction of an efficient AI model by DeepSeek, which could lead to better on-device AI for iPhones. Considering these factors and the trend from previous predictions, the probability of the stock price falling is slightly higher than that of rising.",
  "company_name": "Apple Inc.",
  "company_symbol": "AAPL",
  "news_headline": "Analyst on Apple (AAPL): ‘I Don’t Think AI is a Story Yet’",
  "probability_of_stock_price_rise": 0.42,

}
```
